name: Swarmkeeper
description: Swarmkeepers bond with a swarm of nature spirits that aids them in battle and provides companionship. These rangers might be outcasts or hermits, or they could build vibrant communities that benefit everyone in their swarm.

gathered_swarm.description: At 3rd level, you gain a swarm of intangible nature spirits that can assist you in battle. You determine its appearance or roll on the Swarm Appearance table. Once on each of your turns, you can use the swarm to assist you in one of the following ways after hitting a creature with an attack:
options: The attack's target takes 1d6 piercing damage from the swarm.
The attack's target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be moved by the swarm up to 15 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.
You are moved by the swarm 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.

swarmkeeper_magic.description: Also at 3rd level, you learn the Mage Hand cantrip, which takes the form of your swarming nature spirits. You also learn additional spells at certain levels in this class.

writhing_tide.description: Beginning at 7th level, you can condense part of your swarm to lift yourself up. As a bonus action, you gain a flying speed of 10 feet and can hover for 1 minute or until incapacitated.

details.uses: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.
details.recharge: You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

mighty_swarm.description: At 11th level, your Gathered Swarm becomes more potent. The damage increases to 1d8, and you can knock a creature prone if it fails its saving throw against being moved. You also gain half cover when moved by the swarm.

details.knock_prone: If a creature fails its saving throw against being moved by the swarm, it can be knocked prone.
details.half_cover: When you are moved by Gathered Swarm, you gain half cover until the start of your next turn.

swarming_dispersal.description: At 15th level, you can use your swarm to avoid danger. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to that damage, vanish into your swarm, and then teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet.

details.uses: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.
details.recharge: You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
